body: `AT_ERROR` doesn't support `std::string`, and I'm not sure if `c_str` is best practice. Also, many other similar `std::runtime_error`s are not changed to `AT_ERROR` either. Since this is not the focus of this PR, I think I will leave them as is for now, and wait for a future codemod.
body_html: AT_ERROR doesn't support std::string, and I'm not sure if c_str is best practice. Also, many other similar std::runtime_errors are not changed to AT_ERROR either. Since this is not the focus of this PR, I think I will leave them as is for now, and wait for a future codemod.
